SEARCH
Package gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources

Class RestQueryCollectionResource

java.lang.Object
gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources.RestResource
gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources.RestCollectionResource
gw.api.modules.rest.framework.v1.resources.RestQueryCollectionResource
Direct Known Subclasses:
KeyableBeanRestQueryCollectionResource, ProcessHistoriesPlatformResource
public abstract class RestQueryCollectionResource extends RestCollectionResource
Base class for collection resources backed by a database query. A query-backed collection should extend KeyableBeanRestQueryCollectionResource (or a subclass thereof) if its child resource is backed by a keyable bean. This class can be extended directly if the child resource is not backed by a keyable bean.

    • convertToFilter

      protected FilterField convertToFilter(String propertyName, ApiConfiguration config)
      Description copied from class: RestCollectionResource
      Given a schema property name, returns the FilterField object describing how filtering should be performed. Typically, filtering logic depends on the path to which the property is mapped; the config argument is used to find the appropriate mapper definition. Returns null if no FilterField could be created.
      Overrides:
      convertToFilter in class RestCollectionResource
      Parameters:
      propertyName - the schema property by which to filter this collection
      config - the ApiConfiguration in which to look for a mapping property
      Returns:
      the FilterField

    • getSortColumnMap

      public Map<String,? extends QuerySortColumn> getSortColumnMap()
      Description copied from class: RestCollectionResource
      Returns the valid sort options for this resource. This works the same as RestCollectionResource.getSortColumnMap(ApiConfiguration), using the current operation context's configuration. This method is not intended to be overridden, except to narrow the covariant return type.
      Overrides:
      getSortColumnMap in class RestCollectionResource

    • isPotentiallyLargeQuery

      protected boolean isPotentiallyLargeQuery()
      Override this method to return true if the underlying query could potentially match a huge number of rows, i.e. a top-level endpoint for something like claims or jobs that could have millions of rows. Overriding this to return true will cause the query layer to reject requests that attempt to sort on a non-indexed column, unless the request is sufficiently restricted (due to either permissions or explicit request filters) to a manageable number of rows.
